result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Z Wisnowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $293 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count #1 in Case #15CM74

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No consumption or possession of alcohol & no entry into any bars or taverns.
Court authorizes expungement of both counts upon successful completion of probation.
Defendant must undergo and follow through with an anger management or similar program as recommedned by DOC.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.  The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Z Wisnowski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joseph Z Wisnowski in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:17 AM. Wisnowski has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Wisnowski states he does not want an attorney. Recess to fill out waiver of right to attorney form (9:20 AM). Recalled at 10:15 AM with same appearances. State - resolved - victim is in the courtroom - move to amend #1 to eliminate domestic abuse enhancer - plead g/nc to amended count #1, dismiss and read in count #2, amend complaint to add count #3 to add possesssion of drug paraphanalia contrary to 961.573(1) and plead g/nc to count #3, joint recommendation of a withheld sentence on both counts, place on probation for 9 months - concurrent to each other, with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, costs on count #1 only and fine of $100.00 plus costs on count #3, expungement upon successful completion of probation. Recess to fill out plea questionnaire (10:18 AM). Recalled at 10:28 AM. Court has waiver of right to attorney, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to an attorney, finds he is competent to proceed on his own and will allow him to do so. Court also has plea questionnaire. Court dismisses and reads in count #2, defendant understands what it means to have a count DRI. Court amends count #1 to delete the domestic abuse enhancer. Wisnowski pleads G to amended count #1. Court amends complaint by adding count #3 of possession of drug paraphanalia contrary to 961.573(1) - reads new charge and penalty. Wisnowski understands new charge and penalty and pleads G to count #3 as added. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Wisnowski withholds comment. Victim makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - costs - take bond posted and remainder due thru probation on count #3; count #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 9 months, with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, fine of $100.00 plus costs - paid thru probation, AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, anger management or similar program as recommended by P&P, authorizes expungement of both counts upon successful completion of probation, right to appeal, adjourned.
Bonded prior to PC being set
